intro: Erigeron exaltatus, commonly known as the tall blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas such as prairies and roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its showy blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
